greetings._comment: Handles basic greetings from the user.

pairs.response: Hello! How can I assist you today?
Hi! Ask me anything about campus or academics.
Hey there! Need help with something?
Good morning! How can I help you today?
Good afternoon! What would you like to know?
Hi! Ask me anything about campus or academics.
Having trouble with Wi-Fi? Visit the Student Technology Center or check the IT system status page at https://in.nau.edu/its/
For general tech support, you can reach the ITS Help Desk at (928) 523-1511 or visit the Student Technology Center.
Need IT assistance? Call the ITS Help Desk at (928) 523-1511 or check https://in.nau.edu/its/ for help.
To reset your password, head to the NAU Password Portal: https://password.nau.edu/
Having login issues? Try resetting your password at https://password.nau.edu/ or call ITS at (928) 523-1511.
If your NAU email isn't working, check the IT system status or contact tech support at (928) 523-1511.
For issues with the student portal, visit https://in.nau.edu/its/ or contact the ITS Help Desk.
There are over 300 student clubs you can join — from robotics to drama!
Explore active student organizations through the True Blue Connects portal.
Interested in joining a club? Browse options on the True Blue Connects portal and get involved!
Campus activities include club events, social gatherings, and more — check the calendar on the Student Life page!
Clubs and social groups are a great way to meet people and connect on campus!
Stay safe and be aware of your surroundings. Download the NAU Safe App for alerts and safety tips.
Campus Police are available 24/7 at (928) 523-3611 for any assistance.
In an emergency, use blue light emergency phones located throughout campus or call Campus Police at (928) 523-3611.
The blue light emergency phones on campus connect you directly to Campus Police in case of emergency.
Campus security is always active. For non-emergency help, you can also contact Campus Police.
Lost something? Check with Campus Safety or the Union Info Desk to see if it’s been turned in.

fees._comment: Provides information about tuition fees, payment deadlines, and fee structure.

pairs.response: Tuition fees are due at the beginning of each semester. You can find detailed info in the student portal.
Tuition amounts vary based on your program. Visit the financial services page to view current rates.
The complete fee structure is available on the NAU Financial Services website.
Fee payment deadlines are usually at the start of the semester. Check your portal for the exact date.
Semester fees cover tuition, student services, and more. Refer to the portal or financial office for breakdowns.
You can pay your fees online through the student portal. Multiple payment methods are supported.
A late fee may apply if payment is not made on time. Contact the finance department for assistance.
Looking for installment options? Some payment plans are available—check with Financial Services for eligibility.

food_services._comment: Information about food spots on campus: Hotspot (North side) and Dubois (South side).

pairs.response: Looking for food on campus? Head to the Hotspot (North side) or Dubois (South side) for a variety of options.
The Hotspot offers fast food, coffee, and more. Open weekdays from 7 AM to 9 PM on the North side of campus.
Dubois features healthy meals and vegetarian options. It’s open from 8 AM to 8 PM on the South side.
Campus dining includes both Hotspot and Dubois. Use your meal plan or pay with cash/card at either location.
Hotspot and Dubois function like on-campus restaurants with rotating menus. Check the dining app for updates!
The campus cafeterias, Hotspot and Dubois, offer diverse menus daily. Open throughout the week.
Meal plans are accepted at Hotspot and Dubois. You can also pay by card or cash if needed.
Special meals and seasonal menus are available. Check the NAU dining app for today’s food options!
Dining hours vary: Hotspot (7 AM–9 PM), Dubois (8 AM–8 PM). Hours may differ on weekends and holidays.

cie._comment: Information about the Center for International Education (CIE) for international students.

pairs.response: The Center for International Education (CIE) supports international students with resources and guidance.
CIE provides services and events tailored for international students, from academic help to cultural support.
Thinking about studying abroad? CIE can help you explore global programs and application steps.
Need visa help? CIE assists with F-1/J-1 student visa guidance, renewals, and regulations.
CIE hosts cultural exchange events and activities to help students connect globally and locally.
CIE offers comprehensive support for international students—advising, events, and academic services.
Looking to improve your English? CIE provides language workshops and conversation circles.
CIE organizes orientation programs to help international students transition smoothly to campus life.
For full details about CIE services, visit: https://nau.edu/center-international-education/

ip._comment: Information about the International Pavilion (IP), where international student orientation programs are held.

pairs.response: The International Pavilion (IP) is a hub for international student activities, workshops, and orientation programs.
The International Pavilion hosts events and services to help international students integrate and thrive.
New international students can attend orientation sessions at the IP to learn about life at NAU.
The IP is home to many international programs, including cultural exchange, student support, and academic prep.
Orientation at the IP covers everything from visa guidance to academic expectations and cultural activities.
The IP hosts events like cultural nights, workshops, and mixers for international and domestic students.
For IP orientation schedules and event details, check the campus portal or visit: https://nau.edu/center-international-education/international-house/pavilion/
IP frequently organizes cultural events where students can share traditions, food, and performances.
Looking to meet fellow international students? The IP is the perfect place to connect and make friends.
Data Structures,Program Pradigms,Large scale Data Structures

sodexo_hr._comment: Information about Sodexo-related queries, including the HR office contact at North Campus.

pairs.response: Sodexo manages campus dining services and employee operations. For help, contact the HR office at North Campus.
The HR office handles all Sodexo-related employee inquiries and services. It’s located on the North Campus.
Have questions about meal services? The Sodexo HR office can guide you on meal plans and dining options.
For campus dining concerns or feedback, Sodexo’s HR office on North Campus is your go-to resource.
Sodexo employee inquiries, such as scheduling or job concerns, should be directed to the HR office.
The Sodexo HR office is on North Campus, open Monday to Friday from 9 AM to 5 PM.
Need assistance with Sodexo services? Reach out to their HR team via the campus portal or in person at North Campus.
To report an issue or complaint about campus dining, contact the Sodexo HR office directly.

library._comment: Provides information about library services, timings, and resources available.

pairs.response: The Cline Library is a central hub for study, research, and resources. Open 8 AM–10 PM weekdays, 10 AM–6 PM weekends.
You can borrow books for up to two weeks. Don't forget to renew them online if needed!
Need a quiet space? Book a study room at the library—just check at the front desk or online.
Library hours are 8 AM to 10 PM on weekdays, and 10 AM to 6 PM on weekends.
The library offers borrowing services, digital access, study rooms, and academic support.
Books can be checked out for two weeks. You can renew them through your student portal.
Access academic journals and research databases through the library website using your student login.
Digital books, databases, and research tools are available 24/7 via https://nau.edu/library/
For full library resources and tools, visit: https://nau.edu/library/

bookstore._comment: Provides information about the campus bookstore, available products, and purchasing options.

pairs.response: The campus bookstore has textbooks, electronics, school supplies, and more. You can shop in person or online.
You can buy or rent textbooks from the bookstore. Visit in person or access it through the student portal.
The bookstore offers both purchase and rental options for textbooks—great for saving money!
Looking for tech? The bookstore sells laptops, chargers, and other electronics—check for student deals!
Need pens, notebooks, or other supplies? The bookstore has a wide range of stationery for all your academic needs.
The campus store is your go-to spot for books, gear, gadgets, and NAU merchandise.
You can buy items from the bookstore either online or at the physical location on campus.
For full product listings and online orders, visit: https://in.nau.edu/campus-services-and-activities/bookstore/
Check the bookstore for student discounts on electronics, textbooks, and school supplies!

transit_services._comment: Provides information about public transportation, university transit cards, and external city services.

pairs.response: Metro and local bus options are available to students for convenient city-wide travel.
The Mountain Line bus service connects major areas in Flagstaff, including NAU. Route 10 runs alongside campus.
Flagstaff doesn’t have a subway, but you can get around using city buses like the Mountain Line.
For intercity travel, the Amtrak station is nearby. Check their website for schedules and tickets.
City buses like the Mountain Line are free with your student transit pass. Route 10 serves the campus directly.
Public transport is student-friendly in Flagstaff—use the Transit app for live tracking and route info.
Students get discounted transit passes—apply via the university portal or visit the transportation desk.
You can recharge your bus card at the kiosk near the Student Union building or online.
Download the Transit app to track bus arrivals in real time and plan your routes around town.
Need help planning your trip? Use the campus app or talk to the info desk at the Union building.

academic_calendar._comment: Provides details about the academic schedule and important dates.

pairs.response: You can find the full academic calendar on the official university site: https://in.nau.edu/registrar/important-dates/
Official holidays and breaks are listed on the academic calendar page.
Winter break begins mid-December and runs through early January.
The course catalog with academic schedules is available at: https://nau.edu/catalog/
The Fall semester usually starts in late August and ends mid-December. Check the calendar for exact dates.
Classes for the Fall 2024 semester begin on August 21st.
Vacations include Winter Break, Spring Break, and official holidays. Check the calendar for specific dates.
Visit https://in.nau.edu/registrar/important-dates/ for all key academic deadlines and events.

assignments._comment: Helps users with assignment deadlines and related info.

pairs.response: Check your course LMS or Canvas portal for assignment details and instructions.
Due dates for assignments are usually listed in your course syllabus or Canvas portal.
Make sure to submit before the deadline to avoid penalties. Check Canvas or ask your professor for exact dates.
Project timelines and milestones are usually shared in class or on your course portal.
Assignment submissions are handled through Canvas. Make sure to double-check the file format and submission status.
You can find quiz dates and formats in the course syllabus or announcements on Canvas.
Most professors list assignments, quizzes, and due dates in the course syllabus.

exam_info._comment: Provides information about exams, quizzes, and schedules.

pairs.response: You can find your exam schedule on the student portal. Don't forget to check your course announcements for updates.
Final exams are usually held during the last two weeks of the semester. Check your syllabus for the exact dates.
Tests may vary by course. Refer to your Canvas portal or contact your instructor for details.
Finals are typically scheduled in the last week of the term. You can find the full exam calendar in your student portal.
Midterm exams are generally held halfway through the semester. Your instructor or syllabus will have the schedule.
Quiz dates and formats can be found in your syllabus or Canvas course announcements.
Exam formats (multiple choice, essay, etc.) are usually outlined in the syllabus or explained by your professor.

professors._comment: Helps locate professor info such as contact or office hours.

pairs.response: You can find faculty contact info in the university directory or the course syllabus.
Faculty contact details and office locations are available through the campus directory.
Need to reach your teacher? Check your course page or university directory for their email.
Instructor details including email and office hours are usually shared in your course portal.
Professors typically post their office hours in the syllabus or on the course LMS.
Contact Professor Tayyaba Shaheen for AIS-related questions and support.
You can email your professor using the address listed in the course syllabus or directory.

departments._comment: Information about university departments and their contacts.

pairs.response: Each academic department has its own contact info listed on the university portal.
The Computer Science department is located in the SICS building. You can find faculty details on the departmental site.
Engineering departments offer tutoring hours and faculty office hours — check the portal for details.
Science department contacts and course info can be found in the main academic building or online.
Visit the SICS building for counseling, professor office hours, and tech-related department queries.
Not sure who to contact? Visit your department’s page on the portal or reach out to the front desk of your academic building.
Tutoring hours vary by department. Check with your department or course page for available slots.

career._comment: Gives guidance about internships, jobs, and resume help.

pairs.response: Looking for internships? The Career Center can help you find opportunities and polish your application.
Visit the Career Center for career counseling, resume help, and job search strategies.
Job listings are available on the career portal. You can also find part-time and on-campus job opportunities there.
Our placement services connect students with top recruiters. Make sure your resume is up-to-date!
Need help with your resume? Career advisors offer free review sessions and tips to improve it.
CV and resume writing guides are available at the Career Center or online through the student portal.
Crafting a cover letter? Attend our writing workshops or book a one-on-one session with a career coach.
You can schedule mock interviews with career advisors to boost your confidence and improve your skills.
Don’t miss the upcoming career fairs each semester. Great way to meet employers and explore job options!
Graduation applications are typically due the semester before you plan to graduate. Check the registrar’s page for deadlines.
Getting ready to grad? Make sure you've applied on time and reviewed ceremony details!
The graduation ceremony is usually held in May at the stadium. Invite your family and friends!
To apply for graduation, log in to your Louie account and navigate to the 'Apply to Graduate' section.
To apply Please visit http.Nau.edu.
Don’t forget to rent or purchase your cap and gown before the ceremony. Deadlines apply!
Commencement details including times, location, and dress code are posted on the official NAU commencement website.

tech_support._comment: Tech-related issues like Wi-Fi, login, or devices.

pairs.response: Having trouble with Wi-Fi? Try connecting to Eduroam first. If issues persist, visit the tech helpdesk in the library.
If you're experiencing internet issues on campus, connect to Eduroam or visit IT Support for assistance.
Need help with your laptop? The tech desk in the library offers basic troubleshooting support.
Campus printers are available in the library and select labs. If one isn’t working, report it to IT Support.
For any tech-related issues, contact IT at support@university.edu or stop by the helpdesk in the library.
If you can't log in, try resetting your password via the student portal. Still stuck? Contact IT support.
To reset your password, use the 'Forgot Password' link on the login page or contact tech support for help.
Visit the campus health center near the student union for general checkups, prescriptions, and care.
Need to see a doctor? You can book appointments through the student portal or visit the campus clinic directly.
The clinic is located next to the student union and is open on weekdays for student healthcare services.
Mental health counseling is available for free. Book a session online or through the student support center.
We offer individual and group counseling sessions — just schedule one online or walk in during office hours.
Feeling unwell? Visit the health center or call ahead to speak with a nurse.
Medical services include checkups, lab tests, and prescriptions — all available on campus.
In case of emergency, visit the HLC center or call campus security immediately.
Appointments can be made online via your student portal. Walk-ins are accepted for urgent cases.
Apply for scholarships on the university's financial aid portal. Opportunities are listed year-round.
Financial aid includes loans, grants, and work-study programs. Check the portal for eligibility and application steps.
Grants are typically need-based and don’t need to be repaid. Apply through the financial aid office.
Need help paying for college? Start with the financial aid office — they’ll guide you through scholarships, loans, and grants.
Looking for funding options? Financial aid advisors can help you explore all available money-saving opportunities.
There are several forms of tuition assistance available — both need-based and merit-based.
Scholarship and aid deadlines are usually in March. Apply early through the financial aid portal.
Scholarship applications can be submitted through your student portal. Make sure your documents are updated.

housing._comment: Info about on-campus housing and hostels.

pairs.response: NAU offers various on-campus housing options that include shared and private rooms in residence halls.
You can apply for on-campus housing through the official housing portal. Make sure to submit your preferences early.
Dormitories at NAU include amenities like laundry, study areas, and social lounges.
Room assignments are based on your preferences and availability. Log into the housing portal to check your status.
Residence halls are located across campus — each with its own unique community and facilities.
Move-in usually happens a week before classes start. Check your email for specific dates and instructions.
Need long-term or break-period housing? Reach out to the campus living office for special stay options.
Having an issue in your room? Submit a maintenance request through the housing portal or contact your RA.
Roommate requests can be made during the application process. Both parties must confirm the request.

study_help._comment: Resources for tutoring and academic help.

pairs.response: The university offers dedicated study zones in the library and academic buildings. Quiet and group areas available.
You can sign up for tutoring sessions through the Learning Assistance Center. They cover a wide range of subjects.
Need academic help? Visit the tutoring center or ask your professor during office hours.
Interactive learning tools and resources are available on Canvas and the academic portal.
Have a doubt? Tutors and peer mentors are available in most departments to help clarify course material.
Looking for extra help outside class? Join study groups or connect with academic mentors through the student portal.
Peer mentoring programs are available for most majors. Check with your department for enrollment details.
Stuck on homework? Attend drop-in tutoring hours or use the discussion forums on Canvas.

sports_recreation._comment: Details about gym, sports facilities, and recreation opportunities.

pairs.response: The campus recreation center is open daily and has full gym facilities, including classes.
You can sign up for intramural sports through the campus rec portal.
Recreation events like hiking, yoga, and tournaments are posted on the rec center website.
Fitness classes are offered in the evenings — check the schedule online or at the rec desk.

student_id._comment: Answers questions related to student ID cards, access, and replacements.

pairs.response: Your student ID can be used for library access, meal swipes, and events.
Lost your student ID card? Visit the card services desk to request a replacement.
NAU ID is used for login and services — don’t share it with others!
Some buildings require your ID for access after hours. Always keep it with you!
